titleInfo.title: Status report on the second round of the NIST lightweight cryptography standardization process

name.namePart: National Institute of Standards and Technology (U.S.)

originInfo.publisher: U.S. Dept. of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology ;

physicalDescription.extent: 1 online resource (92 pages) : illustrations (black and white)

mods.abstract: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) is in the process of selecting one or more authenticated encryption and hashing schemes suitable for constrained environments through a public, competition-like process. In February 2019, 57 candidates were submitted to NIST for consideration. Among these, 56 were accepted as first-round candidates in April 2019, and after four months, NIST selected 32 of these as second-round candidates. In March 2021, NIST announced 10 finalists to move forward to the final round of the standardization process. This report describes the evaluation criteria and selection process based on public feedback and internal review of the second-round candidates. The following candidates are selected as finalists: ASCON, Elephant, GIFT-COFB, Grain128-AEAD, ISAP, Photon-Beetle, Romulus, Sparkle, TinyJambu, and Xoodyak.
mods.note: Meltem Sonmez Turan; Kerry McKay; Donghoon Chang; Cagdas Calik; Lawrence Bassham; Jinkeon Kang; John Kelsey.
Title from PDF title page (viewed October 1, 2021).
Approved by the NIST Editorial Review Board on 2021-07-12
Mode of access: World Wide Web.
Systems requirements: Adobe Acrobat PDF reader.

titleInfo.title: NISTIR; NIST IR; NIST interagency report; NIST internal report
